WorkItem.Description:
I am having the following issue while trying to use the optimizer. Have tried this for different machines and I have reseted all item caches.
 
Character is Marquesz Silvermoon EU.
 
Rawr version is 4.0.17b
 
Error message:
 
[Arg_NullReferenceException]
Arguments: 
Debugging resource strings are unavailable.
 
Stack Trace:
   at Rawr.Optimizer.AvailableItemGenerator.<>c__DisplayClasse.<IsCharacterValid>b__1(Item gg)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.Any[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`2 predicate)
   at Rawr.Optimizer.AvailableItemGenerator.IsCharacterValid(Character character, String& warning, Boolean explain)
   at Rawr.UI.OptimizeWindow.OptimizeButton_Click(Object sender, RoutedEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.OnClick()
   at System.Windows.Controls.Button.OnClick()
   at System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.OnMouseLeftButtonUp(MouseButtonEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Controls.Control.OnMouseLeftButtonUp(Control ctrl, EventArgs e)
   at MS.Internal.JoltHelper.FireEvent(IntPtr unmanagedObj, IntPtr unmanagedObjArgs, Int32 argsTypeIndex, Int32 actualArgsTypeIndex, String eventName)
WorkItem.Summary: [Mage] Arg_NullReferenceException when trying to run optimizer

Comments.Message: You forgot to attach your character file.
Updated with character file. Sorry about that.

After playing arround with equipping and unequipping different pieces of gear i found out that the issue lies with the engineering head. I managed for some reason to make the optimizer run only after manually equiping the head and adding the rigid/smooth cogwheels one by one after making them available.

Can you clarify please. You said "I managed for some reason to make the optimizer run only after manually equiping the head and adding the rigid/smooth cogwheels one by one after making them available" Can you explain that please. ie: does loading your file cause the issue and then after doing steps A, B, C with the head piece it works?

If so can you explain what steps A, B and C are precisely. ie: is the headpiece empty of cogwheels when you get the error? Does it have the cogwheels but the Mage model crashes on optimise? Do the cogwheels appear in your gemming templates you have enabled? Just some more details please so we can replicate the issue AND replicate how you solved it manually.
